snippet: Relatives and friends say they believe that Renisha Marie McBride, 19, was merely seeking help at a stranger’s house when she was shot in the face. The authorities say the homeowner thought she was trying to break in.
abstract: Relatives and friends of Renisha Marie McBride believe she was merely seeking help at a stranger’s house when she was shot in the face, whereas authorities say the homeowner thought she was trying to break in; death has stirred long-simmering racial tensions between mostly black Detroit and its whiter suburbs and provoked comparisons to other racially charged cases around the country.

byline.contributor: Steven Yaccino contributed reporting from Chicago, and Susan C. Beachy from New York.

lead_paragraph: Relatives and friends say they believe that Renisha Marie McBride, 19, was merely seeking help at a stranger’s house when she was shot in the face. The authorities say the homeowner thought she was trying to break in.

headline.main: Fatal Shooting of Black Woman Outside Detroit Stirs Racial Tensions
headline.print_headline: Shooting of Black Woman Stirs Racial Tensions Around Detroit
